intro: Umbilicus semenovii, commonly known as the Semenov's umbilicus, is a unique flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by a cluster of bracts. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
